text: Lysipomia vitreola is a species of flowering plant in the family Campanulaceae. It is endemic to the Azuay Province of Ecuador, where it grows in páramo habitat in the Andes. There are three known subpopulations.Moreno, P. and N. Pitman. 2003. Lysipomia vitreola. In: IUCN 2013. IUCN Red List of Threatened Species. Version 2013.1.
